examples: The Venus of Willendorf was an early representation of the female body.
We are no longer happy with your representation of our company at trade events.

definitions.definition: ( by extension , uncountable ) The appearance(s) of a particular demographic group in a piece of media, particularly in regards to how such appearances are treated.
( law ) The lawyers and staff who argue on behalf of another in court.
examples: People who cannot afford representation are eligible for government assistance.

definitions.definition: ( politics ) The ability to elect a representative to speak on one's behalf in government ; the role of this representative in government.
examples: The lack of representation in the British parliament was one of the main factors behind the American Revolution.

definitions.definition: ( mathematics ) An action of some algebraic structure (typically a group or algebra , particularly a Lie algebra ) on a vector space , such that each element acts by a linear endomorphism .
A figure , image or idea that substitutes reality.
A statement ; a presentation of opinion or position, or an utterance made to influence the opinions or actions of others

A figure , image or idea that substitutes reality.
A statement ; a presentation of opinion or position, or an utterance made to influence the opinions or actions of others

definitions.definition: An act of representing , i.e. presenting again.
examples: rates of representation to the emergency department

main_definition: ( medicine ) An act of representing , i.e. presenting again.
